titles.title: To allow the Miami Tribe of Oklahoma to lease or transfer certain lands.
To allow the Miami Tribe of Oklahoma to lease or transfer certain lands.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Natural Resources.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Indian, Insular and Alaska Native Affairs.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Subcommittee on Indian, Insular and Alaska Native Affairs Discharged.
Reported by the Committee on Natural Resources. H. Rept. 114-250.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 189.

action.text: Mr. McClintock moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 487.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Indian Affairs.

calendar.text: Committee on Indian Affairs. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.

action.text: Committee on Indian Affairs. Reported by Senator Barrasso without amendment. With written report No. 114-205.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 349.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

committee.subcommittee: Indigenous Peoples of the United States
committee.name: House Natural Resources

bill.summary:
(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The expanded summary of the House reported version is repeated here.)
(Sec. 1) Allows the Miami Tribe of Oklahoma to lease, sell, convey, warrant, or transfer all or any part of its interests in any real property that is not held in trust by the United States for the tribe.
